intro: Monsonia trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed monsonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Monsonia trilobata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
